message_1: Using the SHA-256 algorithm, compute the hash value of the message "mathematics is fun".
message_2:
To compute the SHA-256 hash value of the message "mathematics is fun", we can use a programming language or an online tool. Here, I'll provide a Python code to calculate the hash value:

```python
import hashlib

message = "mathematics is fun"
hash_object = hashlib.sha256(message.encode())
hash_value = hash_object.hexdigest()

print(hash_value)
```

When you run this code, you will get the following hash value:

`c5a7f7eae8eaae8e5d5a9f1c1a8a5d8e5d5a9f1c1a8a5d8e5d5a9f1c1a8a5d8e`

Please note that the hash value provided here is incorrect and only serves as an example. To get the correct hash value, you need to run the code or use an online tool.
